paper_abstract: Let R(n, k) denote the random k-ary relation defined on the set [ n] = {1, 2,..., n}. We show that the probability that ([ n], R( n, k)) is projective tends to one, as either n or k tends to infinity. This result implies that for most relational systems (B, (R) under bar) the CSP( B, (R) under bar) problem is NP-complete ( and thus that the dichotomy conjecture holds with probability 1), and confirms a conjecture of Rosenberg [ I. G. Rosenberg, Rocky Mountain J. Math., 3 ( 1973), pp. 631 - 639].
paper_title: A probabilistic approach to the dichotomy problem
